content: shortest day shawl by cristina gordon modular wear shawl - 2x sizes uses almost all of a 20g mini or 10g mini or leftover skeins in 2g increments or greater no weaving in ends needle size us 4 - long cable equal or greater than 32 in yarn sock or fingering weight minis or scraps - there are no rules 10 12 row will use almost all of a 20g mini finished size o large size 24x 20g minis - 84 in long x 28 in wide o smaller size 20x 20g minis - 66in long x 28in wide gauge 20sts x 40 row in stockinette 1x ¾ button this shawl is knit in the round and then steeked - making a rectangular wrap/shawl the addition of a buttonhole/button makes an easily folded triangular shawl the larger size is more suitable as a wrap/scarf the steeked panel unravels as planned don t panic for instant fringe this also hides all those pesky ends so there is no weaving in ends at the end of the project cast on using a stretchy cast on cast on 10 stitches place stitch marker sm1 - beginning of round cast on 420 330 more stitches place stitch marker sm2 cast on 10 stitches carefully join in the round ensuring stitches aren t twisted* row 1 knit to 1 before sm1 knit 1 through the back loop slip sm1 knit to sm2 slip sm2 knit 1 through the back loop *if they are twisted don t worry follow this video and untwist it https //www youtube com/watch v=algqdqccnry note do not agonize about being a stitch or 3 off after casting on we re casting on a ton of stitches and if your count is off by a couple it won t make a noticeable difference in the finished shawl repeat row 1 for 10 12 row total ** switch to next color dropping 1st color 10 stitches before sm1 using next color knit 9 knit 1 through the back loop slip sm1 continue using 2nd color for 10 12 row total repeating row 1 continue switching colors every 10 12 row **for the first and last color you may only get 9 11 row out of your mini this is because your cast on /bind off method may use more yarn than a typical knit row 2 to add button/buttonhole 5 row before binding off place buttonhole as following after sm1 knit 5 stitches double yarn over knit three together continue knitting to sm2 slip sm2 knit 1 through the back loop knit 18 stitches knit 1 through the back loop slip sm1 knit 5 knit 1 through the front loop and one through the back loop - continue knitting 3 more row bind off sew on button on last stripe to the right of sm2 steeking and fringe carefully cut between 10th and 11th stitch in steek panel your tube is now a rectangle carefully unravel stitches on each short side of rectangle
